intro: Grevillea obtusiflora subsp. fecunda, commonly known as the broad-leaved grevillea, is a shrub native to Western Australia. It features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of bright red, cylindrical flowers that are highly attractive to nectar-feeding birds and insects. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for coastal and sandy environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is often cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
